title: Pick up new-to-you gear at Ski and Board Swap
text:
Pick up new-to-you gear at Ski and Board Swap Erin Madison, emadison@greatfallstribune.com 10:34 p.m. MDT October 11, 2015 Buy Photo Members of the Great Falls Ski Club make final preparations before the Ski Swap in 2012 in the Trades and Industries Building at Montana ExpoPark. (Photo: TRIBUNE PHOTO/RION SANDERS) Buy Photo 
The Ski and Board Swap offers great deals on new and used ski and snowboard equipment. 
The Swap is Friday and Saturday at the Trades and Industries Building at the Montana ExpoPark. 
“There’s stuff from low end to high end,” said Kari Cann of the Great Falls Ski and Board Swap. 
The Swap is a great chance to outfit an entire family at the fraction of the price that gear would cost retail, she said. 
“We’ll have folks around that can help you fit skis and boots,” Cann said. 
The event includes everything from skis and snowboards to soft goods, such as jackets, hats and gloves. 
The swap runs from 5-9 p.m. Friday and 9 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturday. 
In addition to buying new gear, people can also take advantage of the Ski Swap to sell their old gear. 
“It’s a good way to recycle old stuff or get new stuff,” she said. 
Items to be sold on consignment can be dropped off between noon Friday and 10 a.m. Saturday. All items not sold need to be picked up by 3 p.m. Saturday. People can also opt to donate them to Eagle Mount and Special Olympics. 
The Ski Swap does not sell old straight skis. However, people can bring them to the event to be given away. 
In addition to consignment items, an out-of-state vendor will be on hand with a truckload of equipment. 
Bighorn Outdoor Specialists will have a table, and Seneca Boards, a custom ski company out of Bozeman, will also be there. 
Showdown and Teton Pass will have booths at the swap, as will Eagle Mount. 
The Ski and Board Swap serves as a fundraiser for the Great Falls Ski and Board Club. The groups uses proceeds to promote skiing and snowboarding in northcentral Montana. Great Falls Ski and Board Swap 
When: 5-9 p.m. Friday and 9 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturday
